title: Iraqi Roadsign Font.
content:
Hello all first visit here, be gentle hehe.

Im having trouble identifying this font.

Any help would be fantastic.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [whatfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont_4.jpg) | 40.68 KB |

 [‹ Chanel Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31725 "Go to previous forum topic") ["a very happy birthday" upright informal handwritten script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31707 "Go to next forum topic")
author: duckhunt

comments.content:
Can you replace the link with the jpg.  
It is inaccessible here.

edited, hope that is ok?

thanks

I’m sure they have their own sign letter system and it’s not available as a digital font. [DIN Mittel](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=EF.116513.0.0&fontRendererText=Rutba+Falluja) is similar.

Looks like the [Austrian](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=austria) road sign font.

- Lex

EDIT: Almost but not quite...

Thanks guys. You set me on my way, Ive found this which im happy with.

[https://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&display...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026135618/https:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.110003.0.0 "https://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.110003.0.0")

Il let you know how i get on when im done textruing. Im making a set of Roadsigns for a game set in Iraq.
